result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge filed by Atty Satorius

2:00 PM  Assistant District Attorney Kaley Walker in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brendon J. Larson in Court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in Court for Brendon J. Larson.  Includes Arraignment on 22CF76 & Status on 22TR200.  Court confirms receipt of Information, advises of charges and possible penalties.  Atty. Satorius advises of intent to file substitution but is willing to proceed w/Arraignment.  Further reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Court confirms Defendant's address and phone.  Court states 22TR200 will trail.  Adjourned at 2:03 PM

2:07 PM Brendon J. Larson appears in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. includes 22CF76 (PH) and 22TR200 (STC). Officer Logan Dohmeier present. Atty Satorius states DE would waive the PH. Court questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings. Atty Satorius would like to set an ARN and 22TR200 to follow. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:12 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Atty Satorius would like to set the PH out a couple of weeks. ADA Walker notes the time lines were waived. Court adjourned at 11:04 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Def from PCJ

3:10 PM Defendant Brendon J. Larson appears in custody from Jail via video,  Atty Liesl E. Nelson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $5,000.00 CBS w/conditions of NC w/H.D.D., her residence or place of work, objection, DA Hatch makes statement. Court orders a $500.00 CB w/conditions as requested.DE plans to retain counsel. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:25 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
